p: On the other hand, to our knowledge, no previous works have reported similar concentrations of protocatechuic acid in O. vulgare L. Protocatechuic acid has a wide range of biological and pharmacological activities, including antioxidant, antibacterial, anticancer, antiulcer, antidiabetic, among others [ 17, 18, 19]. The other main phenolic acid in ADARâ€™s O. vulgare L. is gallic acid which has potent antimicrobial, anti-inflammatory and anticancer activities [ 19]. The main flavonoid was luteolin which is recognized for its anti-inflammatory [ 20], and antioxidant [ 21] properties. These characteristics could be associated with the traditional use as anti-inflammatory of this species.
